roleset.name: cause to become very very wet
roleset.note: SOAK-V NOTES: Based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls fill-9.8, wipe_manner-10.4.1, other_caus-45.4. (from soak.01-v)

roles.note: arg 0 might be the liquid in ergative usages. (from soak.01-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [A 10-gallon water cooler]-1 had toppled onto the floor, *trace*-1 soaking the red carpeting.

example.name: prepositional thing getting wet
example.text: The spilled milk slowly soaked into John's homework.

roleset.name: absorb
roleset.note: SOAK_UP-V NOTES: See VNcls wipe_manner-10.4.1, phrasal variant not actually a member though. (from soak.02-v)

example.name: no instrument
example.text: But the recent volatility in stock prices caused by the program trading has made [some market makers]-1 less willing *trace*-1 to soak up the stocks that are for sale.
example.arg: the stocks that are for sale

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John soaked up the spilled milk with his linguistics homework.
